intro: Altamiranoa pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as oaks and maples. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
